Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as no trace of the purported quote can be found in the Nuremberg trials archive.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the quote attributed to Hermann Goering cannot be found in the Nuremberg trials archive.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the quote attributed to Hermann Goering is accurate without providing sufficient evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that the quote attributed to Goering may have been misattributed or fabricated.
Understate: The claim may understate the complexity of human nature and the factors that contribute to people's actions in different political regimes.
Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the power of fear in turning people into slaves and making them do anything a government wants.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by presenting conflicting information about the source and authenticity of the quote attributed to Goering.
